title: How to Stop Procrastinating by Using the Two-Minute Rule
summary: The Two-Minute Rule states: when you start a new habit, it should take less than two minutes to do. This strategy helps you overcome procrastination by making habits so easy you can't say no. Once you've started, it's easier to continue. The goal is to master the art of showing up.
keyIdeas: The Two-Minute Rule: make habits so easy you can't say no.
A habit must be established before it can be improved.
Start with a version of your habit that takes less than 2 minutes.
The goal is to master the art of showing up, not perfecting the behavior.
Once you've started, momentum makes it easier to continue.
Standardize before you optimizeâ€”get the habit established first.
Small starts lead to big finishes.
examples: 'Read before bed' becomes 'Read one page before bed.'
'Meditate' becomes 'Sit and breathe for one minute.'
exercises: Apply the Two-Minute Rule to a habit you want to build.
Identify the gateway habit that leads to your desired behavior.
Commit to a 2-minute version of a habit for one week.
reflections: What habit are you procrastinating on that could be reduced to 2 minutes?
What's the smallest version of your desired habit you could start today?
